edu.iastate.cs309.comminterfaces
Interface Client

All Known Implementing Classes:
TheActualClient
public interface Client

The unified Client interface for the client/server protocol. This is implemented in two places: (1) the server's ClientConnection, which implements these calls over the network, and (2) the Client callback object, which the ServerConnectionCallback thread calls these messages on after reading from the network. The idea is that the network layer is transparent.

Author:
Michael Seibert, sralmai
